title: Should You Trim Your Hair Before a Bikini Wax? What to Know Before You Get Your First Wax

steps.title: No, shaving will make your hair too short for waxing.
steps.content: No, shaving will make your hair too short for waxing. Skip shaving for at least 2 to 3 weeks before your bikini wax, depending on how fast your hair grows. It’s better to let your hair grow longer and then trim it because hair that’s too short is hard for the wax to grip. [1] X Research source If you’re going to a salon, make the appointment ahead of time so you know when to stop shaving.

steps.title: Yes, anything longer than 3⁄4 in (1.9 cm) is too long for waxing.
steps.content: Yes, anything longer than 3 ⁄ 4 in (1.9 cm) is too long for waxing. Use a ruler to measure your hair if you’re worried it’s too long. If it is, no worries. Just trim your hair before your waxing session. [2] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Technically, your esthetician may be able to wax longer hair. However, this can be more painful.

steps.title: It's best for hair to be 1⁄4 to 3⁄4 in (0.64 to 1.91 cm) long.
steps.content: It's best for hair to be 1 ⁄ 4 to 3 ⁄ 4 in (0.64 to 1.91 cm) long. This is the ideal length for getting a wax with minimal discomfort. Keep a ruler handy so that you can check the length of the hairs. Take your time so you can be precise. [3] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source If you’re trimming your hair the same day you plan to wax, leave the hairs closer to 3 ⁄ 4 in (1.9 cm) so you don’t risk cutting them too short.

steps.title: Use a small pair of scissors to trim your hair to 3⁄4 in (1.9 cm).
steps.content: Use a small pair of scissors to trim your hair to 3 ⁄ 4 in (1.9 cm). Grab a pair of safety scissors or mustache scissors because they’re small enough to maneuver around your pubic area. Sit or stand in front of a mirror, then carefully trim your hair. Go slowly so that you don’t accidentally cut yourself. [4] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source It’s best to use smaller scissors because you’ll be less likely to injure yourself. Cut just a few hairs at a time so you can make sure you’re not trimming them too short.

steps.title: Wash and dry your bikini area before your appointment.
steps.content: Wash and dry your bikini area before your appointment. Sweat, oil, and dirt can make it hard for the wax to stick to your skin. If you can, shower shortly before your wax. [5] X Expert Source Mohiba Tareen, MD Board Certified Dermatologist Expert Interview. 26 March 2020. However, it’s also okay to wipe yourself down with a cleansing wipe. [6] X Research source Some salons give you a cleansing wipe to use when you get to your appointment if you want one. Try not to stress out too much about the “cleanliness” of your pubic area when getting a professional wax. Your esthetician is used to doing bikini waxes.

steps.title: Skip lotions, powders, and other personal care products.
steps.content: Skip lotions, powders, and other personal care products. Unfortunately, these products can prevent the wax from sticking. Don’t apply anything to your pubic area before waxing. If you forget, wash the area or use a cleansing cloth to wipe it clean. [7] X Research source It’s okay to use a soap or cleanser before you wax. Just don’t use a product that stays on your skin, like lotion. [8] X Expert Source Mohiba Tareen, MD Board Certified Dermatologist Expert Interview. 26 March 2020.

steps.title: Wear loose, comfy bottoms to your waxing appointment.
steps.content: Wear loose, comfy bottoms to your waxing appointment. You’re probably going to experience some temporary discomfort during and immediately after waxing. Don’t worry because you’ll feel better soon! In the meantime, wear bottoms that won’t be too tight on your skin and won’t cause friction. [9] X Research source For example, you might wear sweatpants or a flowy skirt.

steps.title: Waxing results last for 3 to 4 weeks.
steps.content: Waxing results last for 3 to 4 weeks. It all depends on how fast your hair grows and how long you’ve been waxing. If you continue to wax regularly, your hair will eventually grow back thinner and finer, so your results may last longer. If you’re seeing a professional, talk to your esthetician to see when they recommend scheduling another waxing appointment. [10] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Remember, you’ll need to let your hair grow a bit before waxing again.

steps.title: Yes, you can trim between waxes.
steps.content: Yes, you can trim between waxes. It’s totally normal for your hair to grow back at different speeds, especially if you’ve just started waxing. If this bothers you, use safety scissors to trim your hairs so they’re even. Just don’t trim them too short if you’re planning to wax again soon. [11] X Research source You don’t really need to trim your hairs if they aren’t bothering you.

steps.title: Don’t wax around the time of your period.
steps.content: Don’t wax around the time of your period. You can technically still wax during this time, but it’s not a good idea. You’re more sensitive to pain just before, during, and right after your period. Schedule your wax in the middle of your menstrual cycle so you’ll experience less discomfort. [12] X Research source Most salons will still let you get a bikini wax while on your period if that’s the best time for you. Just check with your salon ahead of time and wear a fresh tampon or menstrual cup.

steps.title: Avoid waxing damaged or irritated skin.
steps.content: Avoid waxing damaged or irritated skin. [13] X Expert Source Mohiba Tareen, MD Board Certified Dermatologist Expert Interview. 26 March 2020. Getting a bikini wax usually causes discomfort, but it’s typically not too painful. However, waxing damaged or irritated skin can really hurt and may cause additional harm to your skin. Wait until your skin heals before you wax. [14] X Research source This includes things like sunburn.

steps.title: Don’t wax if you’re using a medication that thins your skin.
steps.content: Don’t wax if you’re using a medication that thins your skin. The wax is going to tear off the top layer of your skin along with your hair. While this is usually no big deal, thin skin tears more easily. Skip the wax if you’re currently using the following medications: [15] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source An antibiotic. Topical tretinoin (retinoic acid) for acne. Isotretinoin, an acne treatment, which stays in your system for up to 6 months.
